Title: Alphabetical Cartogram
Mouseover text: Poor Weeoming.

Title: Software Testing Day
Mouseover text: The company tried to document how often employees were celebrating Software Testing Day, but their recordkeeping system kept mysteriously crashing.

Title: Good and Bad Ideas
Mouseover text: While it seemed like a fun prank at the time, I realize my prank fire extinguishers full of leaded gasoline were a mistake.

Title: Google Solar Cycle
Mouseover text: From Google Trends, it looks like the lag between people Googling cocktail recipes and 'hangover cure' is 14 hours.

Title: Chasing
Mouseover text: Certain hybrid events can only happen in certain locations where all the conditions are present; chasers flock to the area in and around Kansas known as tumbleweed-colliding-with-possum alley.

Title: Driving PSA
Mouseover text: This PSA brought to you by several would-be assassins who tried to wave me in front of speeding cars in the last month and who will have to try harder next time.

Title: Elementary Physics Paths
Mouseover text: ==COSMOLOGY==> 'Uhhh ... how sure are we that everything is made of these?'

Title: Bloom Filter
Mouseover text: Sometimes, you can tell Bloom filters are the wrong tool for the job, but when they're the right one you can never be sure.

Title: Ocean Loop
Mouseover text: I can't believe they wouldn't even let me hold a vote among the passengers about whether to try the loop.

Title: Exponential Growth
Mouseover text: Karpov's construction of a series of increasingly large rice cookers led to a protracted deadlock, but exponential growth won in the end.

Title: Room Code
Mouseover text: Sorry to make you memorize this random string of digits. If it helps, it can also double as a mnemonic for remembering your young relatives' birthdays, if they happened to have been born on February 5th, 2018.

Title: Local Group
Mouseover text: Cosmologists estimate the spaghetti strand to be about 200 septillion calories, though it could be higher depending on the nutritional value of dark matter.

Title: Complexity Analysis
Mouseover text: PERPETUALLY OPTIMISTIC CASE: Early in the execution, our research group makes a breakthrough on proving P=NP.

Title: Modes of Transportation
Mouseover text: My bold criticism might anger the hot air balloon people, which would be a real concern if any of them lived along a very narrow line directly upwind of me.

Title: Cell Organelles
Mouseover text: It's believed that Golgi was originally an independent organism who was eventually absorbed into our cells, where he began work on his Apparatus.

Title: Fluid Speech
Mouseover text: Thank you to linguist Gretchen McCulloch for teaching me about phonetic assimilation, and for teaching me that if you stand around in public reading texts from a linguist and murmuring example phrases to yourself, people will eventually ask if you're okay.

Title: Unsolved Chemistry Problems
Mouseover text: I'm an H⁺ denier, in that I refuse to consider loose protons to be real hydrogen, so I personally believe it stands for 'pretend'.

Title: Magnet Fishing
Mouseover text: The ten-way tie was judged a ten-way tie, so no one won the grand prize, a rare fishing monopole.

Title: Broken Model
Mouseover text: In addition to eating foxes, rabbits can eat grass. The grass also eats foxes. Our equations chart the contours of Fox Hell.

Title: 1.2 Kilofives
Mouseover text: 'Oh yeah? Give me 50 milliscore reasons why I should stop.'

Title: Pascal's Wager Triangle
Mouseover text: In contrast to Pascal's Wager Triangle, Pascal's Triangle Wager argues that maybe God wants you to draw a triangle of numbers where each one is the sum of the two numbers above it, so you probably should, just in case.

Title: Electric vs Gas
Mouseover text: An idling gas engine may be annoyingly loud, but that's the price you pay for having WAY less torque available at a standstill.

Title: Network Configuration
Mouseover text: If you repeatedly rerun the development of technological civilization, it turns out that for some reason the only constant is that there is always a networking utility called 'netcat', though it does a different thing in each one.

Title: Situation
Mouseover text: We're right under the flight path for the scheduled orbital launch, but don't worry--it's too cold out for the rockets to operate safely, so I'm sure they'll postpone.

Title: Bad Map Projection: Exterior Kansas
Mouseover text: Although Kansas is widely thought to contain the geographic center of the contiguous 48 states, topologists now believe that it's actually their outer edge.

Title: Routine Maintenance
Mouseover text: The worst was the time they accidentally held the can upside down and froze all the Earth's magma chambers solid.

Title: Alien Theories
Mouseover text: They originally came here to try to investigate our chemtrail technology, and got increasingly frustrated when all their samples turned out to just be water ice with trace amounts of jet exhaust.

Title: Bracket Symbols
Mouseover text: ’"‘”’" means "I edited this text on both my phone and my laptop before sending it"

Title: Pole Vault
Mouseover text: Ugh, and we JUST went through this yesterday with javelin.

Title: Number Line Branch
Mouseover text: Attention all passengers: This is an express sequence to infinity. If your stop is not a power of two, please disembark now.

Title: A Crossword Puzzle
Mouseover text: Hint: If you ever encounter this puzzle in a crossword app, just [term for someone with a competitive and high-achieving personality].

Title: Hatchery
Mouseover text: Anadromous fish are more vulnerable in rivers, since the lack of salt means you can quickly crack passwords using rainbow trout tables.

Title: Beam of Light
Mouseover text: Einstein's theories solved a longstanding mystery about Mercury: Why it gets so hot. "It's because," he pointed out, "the sun is right there."

Title: Organ Meanings
Mouseover text: IMO the thymus is one of the coolest organs and we should really use it in metaphors more.

Title: CrowdStrike
Mouseover text: We were going to try swordfighting, but all my compiling is on hold.

Title: President Venn Diagram
Mouseover text: Hard to imagine political rhetoric more microtargeted at me than 'I love Venn diagrams. I really do, I love Venn diagrams. It's just something about those three circles.'

Title: House Inputs and Outputs
Mouseover text: People think power over ethernet is so great, and yet when I try to do water over ethernet everyone yells at me.

Title: Olympic Sports
Mouseover text: Thankfully for everyone involved, the Winter Olympics officials spotted me and managed to stop me before I got to the ski jump.

Title: Chili Tornado Quake
Mouseover text: Buildings constructed from softer materials were damaged by chili pepper impacts to the storm's high Richter-Fujita-Scoville-Mohs hardness rating.

Title: Exam Numbers
Mouseover text: Calligraphy exam: Write down the number 37, spelled out, nicely.

Title: Matter
Mouseover text: He was the first person to land a 900, which is especially impressive because pulling off a half-integer spin requires obeying Fermi-Dirac statistics.

Title: University Age
Mouseover text: This only makes it more urgent that we adopt my roadmap for the next 10 years, which should put us solidly in the lead.

Title: Vice President First Names
Mouseover text: [Political pundit on the ScrabbleTV News channel] "After four years of defying orthographic pressure, Joe ceded the top of the ticket to Kamala, who--after considering Josh, Mark, Andy, Roy, and Pete--picked Tim."

Title: Meteor Shower PSA
Mouseover text: If you hold the meteor too long, it may imprint on you and form a contact binary, making reintroduction to space difficult.

Title: Celestial Event
Mouseover text: If we can get a brood of 13-year cicadas going, we might have a chance at making this happen before the oceans evaporate under the expanding sun.

Title: Helium Synthesis
Mouseover text: Our lawyers were worried because it turns out the company inherits its debt from the parent universe, but luckily cosmic inflation reduced it to nearly zero.

Title: Ferris Wheels
Mouseover text: They left the belt drive in place but switched which wheel was powered, so people could choose between a regular ride, a long ride, and a REALLY long ride.

Title: Storage Tanks
Mouseover text: We're considering installing a pressurization system to keep the tanks at constant pressure solely to deter them.

Title: Classical Periodic Table
Mouseover text: Personally I think mercury is more of a 'wet earth' hybrid element.

Title: Time Traveler Causes of Death
Mouseover text: Many a hungry time traveler has Googled 'trilobites shellfish allergy' only to find their carrier had no coverage in the Ordovician.

Title: Three Kinds of Research
Mouseover text: The secret fourth kind is 'we applied a standard theory to their map of every tree and got some suspicious results.'

Title: Stranded
Mouseover text: At least they're not alone down there.

Title: Sky Alarm
Mouseover text: During the day it also activates for neat clouds and pretty sunsets.

Title: Lava Lakes
Mouseover text: Hey, golf balls float on lava, so this should make recovering them from the hazards easier.

Title: Slingshots
Mouseover text: In my reboot, Dennis the Menace was just trying to send Mr. Wilson a nice comet, but accidentally wiped out his dinosaur garden.

Title: Water Filtration
Mouseover text: You'd think the most expensive part would be the quark-gluon plasma chamber, but it's actually usually the tube to the top of the atmosphere to carry the cosmic rays down.

Title: Monocaster
Mouseover text: My competitors say the tiny single tiny caster is unsafe, unstable, and offers no advantages over traditional designs, to which I say: wow, why are you guys so mean? I thought we were friends!

Title: Asteroid News
Mouseover text: Their calculations show it will 'pass within the distance of the moon' but that it 'will not hit the moon, so what's the point?'

Title: Craters
Mouseover text: It's annoying that the Nastapoka Arc isn't a meteor impact crater, but I truly believe that--with enough time, effort, and determination--we could make it one.

Title: Every Scientific Field
Mouseover text: Conveniently for everyone, it turns out that dark energy is produced by subterranean parasitoid wasps.

Title: Tectonic Surfing
Mouseover text: The worst is when you wipe out in the barrel and you're trapped for several million years until erosion frees you.

Title: Maslow's Pyramid
Mouseover text: The local police, building inspector, and fire marshal are all contesting my 'safety' assertion, or would be if they could reach me past all the traps.

Title: Physics Lab Thermostat
Mouseover text: Hopefully the HVAC people set it to only affect the AIR in the room.

Title: Late Cenozoic
Mouseover text: Our nucleic acid recovery techinques found a great deal of homo sapiens DNA incorporated into the fossils, particularly the ones containing high levels of resin, leading to the theory that these dinosaurs preyed on the once-dominant primates.

Title: Beamsplitters
Mouseover text: Under quantum tax law, photons sent through a beamsplitter don't actually choose which path they took, or incur a tax burden, until their wavefunction collapses when the power is sold.

Title: UK Coal
Mouseover text: The Watership Down rabbits removed an additional 0.1 nanometers constructing their warren, although that was mostly soil. British rabbits have historically mined very little coal; the sole rabbit-run coal plant was shut down in the 1990s.

Title: Ingredients
Mouseover text: Add main-belt asteroids to taste.

Title: Númenor Margaritaville
Mouseover text: I see white shores, and beyond it, a far green country under a tequila sunrise.

Title: University Commas
Mouseover text: The distinctive 'UCLA comma' and 'Michigan comma' are a long string of commas at the start and end of the sentence respectively.

Title: CIDABM
Mouseover text: There's a heated debate over whether the big island of Tierra del Fuego should qualify for membership.

Title: Solar Protons
Mouseover text: If any of you want to meet some cool local oxygen atoms, I can introduce you!

Title: Ravioli-Shaped Objects
Mouseover text: It's a real accomplishment to mess up a ravioli recipe badly enough that the resulting incident touches all four quadrants of the NFPA hazard diamond.

Title: Bad Map Projection: The United Stralia
Mouseover text: This projection distorts both area and direction, but preserves Melbourne.

Title: Experimental Astrophysics
Mouseover text: Our experiment will be expensive, but we believe it will produce important spin-offs, especially if we manage to hit the sun from the right angle.

Title: Temperature Scales
Mouseover text: In my new scale, °X, 0 is Earths' record lowest surface temperature, 50 is the global average, and 100 is the record highest, with a linear scale between each point and adjustment every year as needed.

Title: RNAWorld
Mouseover text: Disney lore: Canonically, because of how Elsa's abiogenesis powers work, Olaf is an RNA-only organism.

Title: Sandwich Helix
Mouseover text: The number one rule of string manipulation is that youâ€™ve got to specify your encodings.

Title: Wells
Mouseover text: You do have to be careful, though--sometimes, instead of water, you hit this free fuel that you can sell for a lot of money instead.

Title: Disposal
Mouseover text: We were disappointed that the rocket didn't make a THOOOONK noise when it went into the tube, but we're setting up big loudspeakers for future launches to add the sound effect.

Title: Demons
Mouseover text: Though they do appreciate how much he improved the heating system for the flame pit.
